newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech February CPI 0.3 pct mo/mo, 7.3 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Czech February CPI 0.3 pct mo/mo, 7.3 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Czech consumer prices rose 0.3 percent in February putting prices 7.3 percent higher than in the same month of last year, the Czech Statistical Bureau (CSU) said on Monday.
CZECH CONSUMER INFLATION Feb 97 Jan 97 Feb 96
FEB CPI BASKET COMPONENTS CHANGE MO/MO CHANGE YR/YR

Note. January basket component changes in brackets. All changes are rises except where stated. Prices have risen 24.1 percent from the average level for 1994 while the sliding average in February using a 1993 base was 8.6 percent. Basket of goods and services is unchanged from 1995.

The CSU said in a statement that seasonal influences accounted for 0.039 percent of the month-on-month figure, putting seasonally-adjusted growth at 0.377 percent. It added that core inflaiton was 0.333 percent for the month and that the influence of price deregulation was 0.044 percent.
